articles.content:
Cause of Korean People Supported 
    Pyongyang, December 1 (KCNA) -- DPRK Ambassador Chon Jae Hong paid a courtesy call on Mari Bim Amude Alkatiri, chief minister of East Timor and leader of the Revolutionary Front for Independent East Timor, on November 25.
 The chief minister stated that the front and the government and people of East Timor would extend positive support and solidarity to the Korean people in their efforts to build a prosperous country and achieve reconciliation and cooperation between the north and the south of Korea and the independent and peaceful reunification of the country under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Il.    
 He said the front would develop its relations with the Workers' Party of Korea and assiduously learn from the experience of the WPK and the Korean people in their struggle.

articles.content:
Greetings to Lao President
    Pyongyang, December 1 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, today sent a message of greetings to Khamtay Siphandone, president of the Lao People's Democratic Republic, on the occasion of the 28th anniversary of its foundation.
 Congratulating the government and people of Laos on their new success in the work to carry out the resolution made at the 7th congress of the Lao People's Revolutionary Party, the message expressed belief that the traditional friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would steadily grow stronger.
